inn1.comm: good length, on leg stump, falls over it slightly and turns the ball short on the leg side
middle and leg, length delivery and Marsh defends it with a straight bat coming forwards
touch shorter, quick and in the channel outside off, left alone

pitched up, Marsh prods and edges through to the keeper - gone! Poor shot from an opening batsman, the ball didn't really do anything off the pitch but Marsh's feet were stuck in a bog and he dangled his bat outside off stump, there was a big deflection and Buttler took a comfortable catch at chest height

plants the front foot, the ball slams into Watson's ginormous front pad and Kettleborough raises the finger! Watson looks bemused, like someone has taken his favourite toy away, and asks for the review ... This is very tight, there's a big mark on Hot Spot but Kettleborough seems to have asked Aleem Dar, the third umpire, to check that it is not bat on pad. The standing umpire was convinced that bat missed ball and his the front pad but Dar isn't sure ... It's fiendishly difficult to tell from the replays, but Dar decides there is enough evidence to overturn the decision - so Watson survives
good length delivery in the corridor outside off stump, left alone this time
bit of width outside off, Finch rocks back and chops a single behind point
back of a length, this jags in towards the batsman awkwardly, Watson does well to keep it down
full and wide, throws the plumbing at it and misses completely
pitched up and driven to mid-off, the throw in hits the stumps, I think, but they decide against trying to sneak one
short of a good length and in the channel outside off, drops back and steers behind square
rearing off a length and Finch drops back, defends into the leg side
slightly full, Watson gets a stride in and attempts to drive, slightly early on the shot, comes off the inside edge towards midwicket
stays back and glides the ball down to third man
wider, on a length and left alone by Finch
pitched up around the line of off stump, leans forward to defend back down the track
hops back and lifts the arms into the arm to a length ball outside off
at the body, touch short and glanced off the hips, the ball runs fine and they get a couple as Jonathan Trott ambles round the boundary to field
back of a length and the ball goes searing through past the outside edge as Watson draws his bat inside the line
gets forward and drives, not a clean connection and it bobbles to mid-on
lovely shot, riding the bounce and thumped between midwicket and mid-on, Watson pulling firmly for the first boundary of the innings
comes forward and dabs one into the covers
another short-of-a-length ball whizzes through outside off as Finch shoulders arms
seaming back at the batsman, who tries to guide the ball to leg but rolls short off the pad
ooh, this nearly goes wrong for Watto, trying to guide one to third man and it bounces a little on him, hits the glove and ends up lodge behind the flap of his back pad
length, outside off and a big woolly woof from Watson, trying to hit the leather off it and missing the ball entriely
now that's a good shot, slightly overpitched from Finn and Watson transfers the weight into a serene straight drive back down the ground
good length outside the line of off, opens the face and steers a couple through backward point
tries to run the ball off the face again and it doesn't come off again, the ball deflecting down past the stumps towards the slips
fast and bouncy length ball outside off, Watto swishes his bat in the wind and misses again
shaping in off a length, worked off the front pad to midwicket, where it's not stopped cleanly and they get one
length delivery, holding its line outside off and flying through as Watson pushes at it
this is a good line to Watson, an even better delivery that is a whisker away from brushing the edge, nibbling off the seam as Watson goes hard at it
shouts of "catch!" as Watson fends, gets a thick outside edge short of point, well fielded on the bounce
drops short and Watson seems more comfortable with that, swivels through a flat pull through square leg. It's all gravy
length delivery, shaping back in from outside off, stays back and guides one to third man
slightly short of a length and over the top of off stump, slightly squared up in defence but gets behind it
gets a big stride in to defend on the front foot
tight lines from Finn, again Watson presses forward to block
plants the front foot and defends a length ball on off back down the track

Finn continues to probe on off stump, this wasn't overly full but Watson was happy to hit through the line, more of a chip than a drive and it came slightly high off the bat, cleared mid-on and bounced away to the rope
terrific response from Finn, after five vanilla deliveries on off stump he digs in something short, with a bit of flavour and Watson jerks himself underneath it
this goes all wrong for Finch but he gets away with it! Tried to pull a back-of-a-length delivery from outside off, got a big top edge but it ballooned beyond the slips and short of third man
fullish and driven on the front foot to mid-off
beautiful delivery, holding its line and edged, just a tickle but it drops short of Buttler before bouncing into the gloves. Rankin shakes his head in disbelief
and Watson exacts his revenge, Rankin a touch full and wide and hammered through the covers, reaching for it slightly back the hands went through the shot so quickly
tight line, comes forward and defends a length ball
dug in, hits the deck hard and the ball flies through as Watson leans back
on the stumps, whipped through midwicket, well timed by Finch and although Pietersen gamely gives chase, his feet touched the rope before he managed to pull it in
slightly short, pulled into the ground but straight to midwicket
smashed! Finch on the pull and that would have gone through masonry, such was the power, it went hard and flat past square leg for another boundary
flicks to leg, gets slightly under a length delivery and the ball loops over Carberry at square leg
outside off, comes forward to block a length delivery
a little fuller from Finn, driven on the up and it runs wide of mid-off for a couple more
starts with a low full toss, Watson punches it straight to mid-on
full of a length, outside off and maybe sticks in the pitch, Watson drives, gets an inside edge on to his front pad
another full toss, wide of the stumps this time and flayed through cover point, Watson giving that the treatment it deserved
full of a length, outside off and driven to mid-off
too full and wide again, Watson gets hold of the ball and drills wide of mid-off, but a terrific diving grab with one hand keeps them to just a single
length ball, outside the line again and Finch goes hammer and tongs, thickish outside edge flies down towards third man
length ball on off stump, sticks in the wicket a little and Finch gets a leading edge trying to pat across the line of the ball
gets on the front foot and drives one through the covers
Watson stays back, dangles his bat out horizontally and is beaten, Buttler taking it up to the stumps
length ball, Watson pushes into the off side

there's a mix up and England could have had a run-out at both ends! Watson pushed the ball to mid-off and both he and Finch set off before realising there wasn't a run, Root could have thrown it to Buttler at the striker's end, decided to have a shy at the bowler's end and missed, with both batsmen out of their ground
on a length outside off, sits back and glides a single to third man
tossed up and skids on with the arm outside off, defended
pushed through, Watson comes forward and defends
worked off the front pad to midwicket
bit more air on this and Watson gets to the pitch, clatters a big ole mow over wide long-on, there was a man out there but it clears him into the crowd
turn for Tredwell, this spins back and cramps Watson as he tries to cut
gets in a tangle again, flatter and quicker and Watson is beaten pushing outside off
length ball outside off, steered through backward point and wide of third man for a couple
gets forward and pushes one into a gap in the covers
slightly full, around the line of off, pushed back on the front foot

length, outside off, Watson tries to cut off the back foot, he misses - or does he? Bopara is convinced he hit this and England review. We're into Clockwork Orange replay territory, the footage run over and over again from different angles; there's a definite sound as the ball passes, seemingly over the top edge - but the side-on, Hot Spot angle, has the ball going past the toe of the bat, and no heat mark. This is very tricky, as the different camera angles almost look like they're showing different deliveries... but Dar decides the audio is clear, there's nothing else the bat could have hit as the ball went through, and the decision is overturned. Watson has to go this time!
length ball, wide of the stumps and chopped to point on the back foot
width again, drops back and guides one down to third man
slightly back of a length and outside off, turned to leg
comes forward and blocks
hops back, the ball seams in and rises off a length, defended behind square on the off side
good-length delivery, outside off and coming back, Finch thrusts out a pad and leaveas
pitched up a bit further, defended coming forwards
full and in the channel, punched into the ground and fielded by Rankin in his follow through
little bit of width and Clarke steers cut-dab through point
length ball, around off, pushed back on the off side
slightly full, Finch hits out and just clears mid-off, came off the bat near the toe but there was enough on it, the ball runs for four
works the ball of the pads into the leg side
pitched up on the stumps, Clarke drives, fine of mid-on but there's no run
width offered again, stays back and runs another single down to third man
dug in short, the ball rises to a good height on its way through as Clarke drops his hands inside the line
half an appeal from Rankin, as he beats Clarke for pace on the inside, hits the pad ... heading down past leg, though
length, on the stumps and worked through square leg from deep in the crease
Finch gets forward to a length ball around off
little bit wide, Finch drives and gets a thick edge through gully/third slip, single down to third man
Clarke deals with this well enough, not really a bouncer from Rankin and it sits up to be pulled smartly through midwicket for four
on the stumps, nurdled to leg for one more
bangs this in short of a length, again Clarke is equal to it, keeping a pull shot down towards deep square leg
little bit short and width for Finch to cue end one down to third man
the bat turns in the hand as Clarke attempts an expansive drive, the ball screws away through square leg
comes forward, hitting slightly across the line and the ball pings back to Bopara
touch back of a length, pushed to mid-on off the back foot
tossed up, comes forward and worked with the spin into a gap on the leg side

there's an lbw appeal from Tredwell, think the ball hit pad before bat, but umpire S Ravi isn't interested. No one else was, really, but Morgan decides the go with his bowler and England review. This looks a little speculative, though it was definitely pad first ... the line is the key and Hawk-Eye adjudges the ball struck fractionally outside off, so Finch survives
little bit wide and Finch drops back, cuts one through point to the sweeper
excellent footwork makes this a drivable delivery for Clarke, who lasers the ball through extra cover and all the way to the rope
tossed up, spinning in and defended coming forwards
Clarke is on the walk again, works thew ball into midwicket and they pick up a couple
pitched up in the channel, driven with a flourish but straight to mid-off
length delivery, little bit wider and crunched off the back foot through point, there's a man out there
slightly back of a length and the ball jags in, hits Clarke in the midriff, they steal a bye as Stokes runs in from point and misses trying to kick the ball on to the stumps
pitched up and punched towards mid-off
hit on the pad by a fullish ball that tails in, would have slid past leg
goes across and works the ball into the leg side
tossed up, spinning from off to leg and nudge through square for one

gives it some air and Tredwell is again carted for six! Agricultural stuff from Finch but with those forearms you'd happily let him plough your field, he plants his front foot and slog-sweeps flat over midwicket
flatter, pushed back down the track
makes a bit of room and drives one through the covers
dainty footwork from Clarke, who looks like he's auditioning for a spot on Strictly Come Prancing, flutters down the pitch and lofts Tredwell over mid-off for four
gets forward and works the ball back down the ground to long-on
length ball, pushed on the front foot towards mid-off
tight line and Clarke can only work the ball back to the bowler
little bit wider, Clarke drops back and glides one down to third man
waits, dabs the ball short and square on the off side for another single

woof, beaten and the ball flying just over the top of the stumps! Buttler though there might have been an edge but Bopara wasn't so interested, Clarke dropping back and attempting to run the ball off the face, failed to make contact
tapped short into the covers, thinks about stealing a base but quickly turns back
tossed up around off stump, Finch backs away and cracks the ball flat down the ground, the man at long-on gets there but can't cut it off
pushed back past the bowler for long-on
flighted, on off stump, Clarke skips forward and hits the ball inside to out, against the spin but cleanly and crisply over extra cover for another boundary
comes forward and works the ball down the ground again

goes for another big slog down the ground but picks out long-on! Finch has given it away, launching the ball flat and straight down the gullet of Joe Root on the fence, who barely has to move and swallows it without fuss
floated up, comes forward and turns the mid-on
touch short, around off stump, Clarke stays back and defends
outside the line of off stump, goes back and dabs one behind square on the off side
on the stumps, works across the line and picks up one through midwicket to get off the mark
wide of the stumps, Clarke stays back and steers the ball to point
tight line, opens the face and drops the ball short, point fields
good bouncer from Stokes, zips through at 85mph and Clarke ducks smartly under it
tossed up on the stumps, Bailey comes forward and pushes one to long-on
Tredwell goes round the wicket, Clarke on the move again, closes the face for one through midwicket
punches back past the bowler, who can't stop it diving to his right
on the stumps, plays with the turn for one in front of square out towards the sweeper
good rotation of the strike from these two, Bailey using his feet and clipping another single through midwicket
round the wicket, flatter and on leg stump, glanced through square
pitched up on off stump, pushed back and into the ground, fielded on the bounce by Stokes
good pace from Stokes, bit of width and the ball is edged through the slips as Clarke throws the hands, no one there, though, and it will fly to the boundary
goes full and straight, Clarke had gambled on that, opened his body and thrashed a drive straight at mid-off
waits on a slower ball, drops short of point and calls Bailey through, a direct hit would have made things interesting
stays back and guides a length ball to point
Morgan again swoops in from square of the wicket to prevent Bailey from picking up one
continues round the wicket, pushed back down the track
flighted, outside off, leans out and defends with a straight bat
tossed up on the stumps, comes forward and nudges one down the ground to long-on
BOOM goes the dynamite! Bailey on the charge, gets plenty of bat on a lofted shot straight down the ground, goes all the way
driven back and well fielded by Tredwell
tossed up on the stumps and worked through the leg side
tight line and defended around off stump
good nut from Stokes, a little wide but it darts away as Bailey wafts and misses in the channel
done him again, Bailey prodding forward uncertainly outside off, beats the outside edge on its way through to Buttler
pitched up and dropped into the covers for a single
Stokes is working up good pace and bounce right now, gets one through past Clarke's leaden-footed swish this time
punched into the covers, another dot - excellent over from Stokes
slightly full and tailing in, clipped through midwicket for a single
fullish, wide of the stumps, pushed to the fielder in front of square
takes a bit of pace off of, Clarke a little early on the shot but he manages to check it, the ball dying and bouncing into the stumps at the other end as Bopara threw himself to his right
good length, comes forward and pushes into the covers
tight stuff from Bopara, the batsman comes forward and plays with a straight bat into the covers
low full toss, wide of the stumps and pushed to mid-off for a single
slightly full, Clarke throws the hands through an uppish drive, gets under it but the shot has the distance to clear Finn running back from mid-off
gets forward, drives hard at the ball and gets an inside edge through square
short ball, stops a little on Bailey and his pull lobs in the air but safe through midwicket
gets on the front foot and punches to cover
full of a length outside off, driven into the ground and back to Stokes
touch overpitched and Bailey smites the ball over long-on again, excellent stroke, hitting through the line and clearing the rope
tossed up and blocked on the front foot
spinning back in from outside off, Clarke manages to keep it out
heaves across the line, a lot of bottom hand and picks out a gap towards deep midwicket
flatter, skidding on, Clarke works the ball flat off the pads, decides against a second
on the stumps, darted in, turned short on the leg side
flat, on the stumps and swept in the air, safely beyond Finn to the now-unguarded boundary - that's four and it brings up a half-century for Clarke
ever-so-slightly full, on middle and off and flicked meatily through midwicket, beats the man on the ring and runs away
shortens his length, dabbed short on the off side for one more
stays back, Clarke opens the face and guides the ball fine, might have come off the shoulder of the bat but it was well played, beating third man for another boundary
length on off stump, drives with the bat away from the front pad, inside-edged through backward square leg
short, attempted bouncer and pulled flat through square for one
back of a length, seams back in as Clarke tries to cut, takes the bottom half of the bat and bounces back down the pitch
tossed up, punched back down the ground to long-on
drags this a little short, swivels through a pull to deep midwicket
drifts down the leg side, Bailey had moved across his stumps and sweeps hard, deep backward square keeps them to one
glances firmly off the pads, Morgan throws himself to the ground at midwicket and makes a good stop
stops a little, the ball pops off the bat face and runs down to long-on
flatter, skids through on to the pad and runs short on the leg side, Buttler gives chase
round the wicket, tossed up and straightening down the leg side, Bailey misses it, not called wide though
this loops up off the front pad, Buttler runs forward and takes it but there wasn't any bat or glove involved
pushed forward on leg stump again, this does take the shoulder of the bat, on to the front pad but plops safely square, Buttler unable to get there
works one off the pads to midwicket
drops back and cuts late from in front of the stumps, picks out point
floated up on the stumps, glanced in front of square on the leg side for one more
slightly short of a length, comes back at Clarke of the pitch as he tries to cut
hit on the up, just an ice cream scoop down the ground, mid-on gives chase but that will be four
Finn digs the ball in short, outside off stump and battered between midwicket and mid-on, superb placement on the pull stroke from Clarke and that's another boundary
short again, the bumper veering down the leg side as Clarke crouched out of the way
back of a length outside off, tapped into the ground short of point
slightly back of a length, beats Bailey for pace and hits him on the back thigh as he prods from the crease
length ball around off, gets forward and pushes into the covers, they take on Carberry's arm and get home safely enough
length ball, poked at from the crease, genuine nick and it runs fine of third man, very unfortunate for the bowler, good delivery, forced and error and still concedes four
good length on middle and leg, whipped down to long leg
length ball on off stump, dropped from the back foot into the covers and the grab a quick single before backward point can get in
similar line, dabbed too close to extra-cover this time for a single
touch tighter line and played off the back foot towards midwicket
fuller a foot outside off, played forward and plays and misses, good back end of the over
excellent yorker-length on off stump, dug out into extra-cover
just back of a length and picked up over midwicket, well struck with a straight-arm jab and timed it superbly
back of a length, 77mph slower ball, Clarke wait for it and cuts without timing, cover saves well and they steal a run
slightly shoirt of a good length and hammered on the pull in front of deep square leg, well struck, four more
good length on off stump, dabbed from the crease up on the off side
fuller length, 78mph cutter, dabbed from the crease towards point, they get a single in front of the fielder
short and pulled high on the bat over mid-on, just enough bat to clear the fielder, rather clothed with a stroke leaning back and trying to heave over the in-field
tries to pull a good length ball outside off and misses, rather too big a swing, position was poor and overbalanced
leans back again and cuts this to backward point from just outside off, straight to the fielder
good length a foot outside off, bit of a nothing stroke really, playing from the crease, fiddles it outside off and misses
similar area, dabbed from a foot outside off in front of cover for a sharp single
backs away and tries to clear the off side field who are all up in the circle, Rankin followed him with a good length ball and Clarke missed
length on off stump, tucked from the crease to midwicket on the edge of the circle for an easy single
poor ball, length on the pads and tickled past short long leg, awful ball to that field
short and pulled firmly but straight to Bopara at deep midwicket

gorgeous shot, length on off stump, right in the slot for Bailey to swing through it and he nails it straight over the bowler's head for six, magnificent timing, just cleared the front leg a little to give him room to swing the bat, very nice half-century
slower ball, very slower, waited for and pulled to deep midwicket
full length on off stump, Clarke forward dabbing up the wicket and the bowler fields going to his left
step across the stumps and playing with the spin through square leg into the deep
shimmy down and flick with the spin through square leg again
played out through square leg yet again, this softly played off the front foot and they run hard and get back for the second
forward, nice length ball, had to adjust and flick off middle and leg to short long leg, they steal a run
using his feet again to flick out through the leg side, finds deep midwicket
swept off the stumps to the 45, goes too quickly to the fielder for a run
good length, tried to be swung over the leg side, gets a toe end through midwicket
length ball angled in, Clarke was aiming off side, got a thick inside edge to leg, they run hard as the ball runs up towards long-on but just a single
slower ball on off stump, pulled through midwicket, just a single again
slower ball well wide of off stump, swung at and missed, probably a wide but not called
this is wide because it's down the leg side, Buttler does well to parry it and save five
tries to step to leg and force through the off side, gets it high on the bat to mid-off
this time clears the off side, little step away to leg to give the space to swing the arms, takes a length ball from off stump and lifts it over Rankin at mid-off, good strike, ruins a decent over
long leg is up in the circle and this is clipped past him for four, Bailey stepped to leg slightly, Stokes followed him, Bailey stepped back inside it and clipped past the short fielder
pulled firmly into the deep, they run hard and beat Carberry's throw from deep midwicket, he fumbled slightly and that was crucial
full on off stump, swung hard, good connection but only as far as mid-off
full, angled in to the pads, pushed up towards long-on
slower ball, 68mph, waited for and pulled steadily out to deep square leg for a single
yorker length on middle, dug out into midwicket and the bowler is quickly across to field, funny how yorkers often work
slower ball. 66mph on off stump, heaved over the leg side, Stokes is out at deep midwicket but it's over the fielder's head but short of the rope, criminal that Stokes is off the rope
just back of a length and nailed over midwicket this time into the crowd
length well wide of off stump, tried to be cut and missed
slapped through the off side from off stump straight to extra-cover, they take on the fielder and get home easily, well ran
slower ball, spotted on off stump, chipped gracefully down the ground for a one-bounce four, nicely struck
step to leg, Bopara follows him and the off side stroke comes off an under edge back to the bowler
full ball, angled in, tried to be swung over the leg side and misses, gets hit on the body
low full toss on off stump, carved towards cover point who saves but they get a single
length ball on the stumps, covered up and tucked through square leg for a single
cutter outside off, 76mph, slapped off the bottom of the bat to mid-off, they sprint and get a run
length on leg stump, clipped down to long leg
full at the pads, tried to be smashed to Liverpool, Bailey misses and Stokes runs up to save the single as it ran off the pads
oh dear, beamer I think, yep, Clarke backs away and manages it angle it past the wicketkeeper for four, just slipped out from Bopara and nearly took out the batsman and Buttler
slower on off stump, ran down to long-on, the sprint and get back for two and that is a tremendous century from Clarke, his first in ODIs against England, he's been excellent
length ball on the stumps, pulled around out towards deep square leg, they fielder does well to save two

length ball on leg stump, Bailey swirls and pulls and picks out Tredwell at short long leg. Unlucky for Bailey really, he helped it on its way down the leg side, tried to keep it down but slapped it directly to Tredwell who held a solid chance with two hands at knee height, a gift for England and ends a fine innings
full just outside off, ran wide of mid-off and they get a quick single
length ball on off stump, guided to point
this time Clarke picks out Tredwell at short long leg but safely on the bounce flicking around the corner
nice length delivery just outside off, it holds it line a little and beats Clarke as he tries to run it down fine
slower ball, 76mph, length on off stump, clothed down the ground and just a single to long-on
length just outside off, dabbed down towards third man
backs away, Stokes follows him on a full length and Clarke can only play up to mid-off for a single
full just outside off, played from the crease and angled down to third man
full on off stump, tried to be swung down the ground, find mid-off, full and straight, it ain't too hard
full length on the stumps, played forward and blocked up the wicket
full length on off stump, dabbed towards point, Bopara in quickly to save the single
just back in length, pulled through midwicket and they get a couple in front of deep square leg
similar line, wide of off stump, chopped wide of third man and they nearly get back for three on a fumble
short ball on off stump, Voges lets it go by
slower ball on the stumps, pulled out to deep square and a nice cheap over from Finn
length on the stumps, flicked down to long leg and Voges manages to get away from the strike early this over

swing to a length ball just outside off, thin nick and taken by Buttler. Those seven balls that Voges faced forced Clarke into a quite wild swing from a poor base and he's got a thin edge behind bringing to an end a marvellous innings

length ball on off stump, Wade plays a nothing stroke really from the crease trying to run it down towards third man, the delivery was too close for the stroke and he's dragged it on. Beaten for a pace a little and got a thick inside edge into off stump
good delivery, full on off stump, carefully blocked up on the off side, finds cover
full length wide of off stump, tried to be swung through the off side and misses
yorker-length outside off, angled out through cover, fine over from Rankin, just what England needed
length on the stumps, angled down to third man backing away to leg and they get a single
full on off stump, driven down the ground, mid-on makes a good save sliding to his left
just back of a length, clears the front leg and swings it over the leg side, good strike wide of midwicket, length ball punished again, when will they learn

another ball just back in length, Faulkner did too much on the crease and ended up leg side of it and had to angle it down to third man, had he stood still he could have aimed another leg side swipe at it
full, wahey, on the stumps, dabbed into midwicket and they get two wide of long-on but had they set a proper field for full bowling there would surely have been a midwicket saving one
length on the stumps, slapped to point and they get a single
yorker length on leg stump, clipped through square leg and just a single as the deep fielder does very well
full at leg stump, a leg side swipe gets just a single to deep midwicket
another good full ball at the stumps and again just a single to deep midwicket, get a man up
step to leg, Rankin followed him with another full delivery, comes off the pad as Faulkner tried to swing to leg, Rankin saves the run
full at the stumps, gets the length just slightly wrong and Faulkner is back in his crease to smash it over long-off, huge strike
goes again for a one-bounce four between the two deep straight fielders
full and follows the batsman who had cleared the off side, squirts it out through midwicket

steps to leg and tries to clear the off side but gets it slightly high on the bat and finds extra-cover where Morgan takes a good low catch down by his bootlaces. Finn followed the batsman and slightly cramped him for room
full on the stumps, Johnson step to leg and swings hard through the off side, connects well and steers it past cover point
slower, 77mph, on leg stump, flicked behind square and gets it wide of long leg for two
another slower ball, 78mph, just outside off, a big swing and a miss for strike one, batsman totally deceived
slower again, another swing and a miss, they run to the keeper and get home for the bye

inn2.comm: good length on off stump, Pietersen forward and gets an inside edge into the pads
step down the wicket and watches a full length ball go past off stump
shoulders arms again to a ball wide of off stump
more of a good length, Pietersen is blocking from a good two feet outside off to cover
full length on off stump, firm drive to mid-off
forward and pushing a length ball towards point
full length wide of off stump, left alone
good length a foot wide of off stump, Carberry plays inside the line
slightly tighter line, good pace, 92mph, well left a few inches outside off
cry for caught behind here as Carberry leaves again, they're asking for a brush of the glove but nothing given
full length, swings away and flies through at head height to Wade, Carberry played and missed just outside off, very well bowled
push forward and finds point just outside off stump
step down the wicket and tries to fiddle a length ball to leg, shaped back in a little that did
forward and pushed from off stump to mid-off, straight to the fielder
finally England are away, ironic cheers greet a tuck through square leg from a length ball on middle and off
blocked in the crease around off stump, dabbed towards point
length ball just outside off, punched through point and nicely timed, it runs away quickly to the fence
length ball angled across Carberry, who played inside it
slip and a short midwicket to Pietersen, length down leg
full wide of off stump, driven but not timed to mid-off
length ball a foot wide of off stump, dabbed into the covers, too close to the fielder though
short extra cover now but leg side again, Wade went up in a stupid appeal for caught behind
full on off stump, Pietersen is forward and dabbing just wide of mid-on so they steal a single
back of a length a foot wide of off stump, pushed firmly to backward point

back of a length a foot and a half wide of off stump, cut hard but cut straight to backward point for the simplest of chances. Right shot but poor execution, struck it well enough but slapped it at shouldered height straight to Clarke who didn't have to move to take the catch
leg slip in straight away, bowled for the tuck to leg slip but got it too far down leg

got him! Super delivery, back of a length, it bounced a little on Trott right on line and he nicked it through to Wade a cracking delivery from Johnson. An absolute beauty angled across Trott, it bounced on him, he couldn't get the bat out of the way and got a thick edge for a simple chance to Wade's right
length ball two feet wide of off stump, left alone
nicely bowled, Pietersen forward and played at it, got beaten, should have been left
full much tighter to off stump, ran just wide of mid-off for a quick single
full and wide of off stump, ignored
length ball on off stump, dabbed hanging back into the covers
length ball wide enough of off stump to leave alone
length ball wide of off stump, Pietersen throws the hands at it and gets an under edge towards cover
full a foot wide of off stump, left alone
good length ball a few inches outside off, Pietersen plays from the crease and gets an inside get into the front pad which runs up the wicket
full just outside off, driven firmly to the left of mid-off so they try a quick single and get home comfortably
forcing stroke off the back foot to a ball sliding across him, misses
full delivery just outside off, dabbed into the covers
full on off stump, Pietersen tries to flick to leg but mistimes it and finds midwicket
gets this flick away, beats midwicket and there's a long chase for mid-on back to the long-on fence
full delivery on off stump, played forward and blocked into the covers
full on off stump, Root forward and tucking to midwicket
length ball wide of off stump, Root goes back and aims a fierce slash at it and misses
full on off stump, a firm nudge up to mid-off for another dot
full just outside off, it was driveable, Pietersen flung the arms at it and got a thick inside edge to midwicket
full on the stumps, flicked up to mid-on, didn't really time it, Pietersen hasn't got the pace of Johnson on this deck worked out yet
full and wide, Pietersen reaches a long way out to it and makes a decent connection past point, slightly off the toe but gets four
length on the stumps, dabbed into midwicket, Finch roars in from square leg to try and run Pietersen out but he fumbles
full and wide enough to cover drive, Root gets it low on the bat and finds the fielder

short down the leg side, Root goes to hook it and gets a tickle on it, Wade diving to his left and the chance is dropped and a chance that should have been taken. Wade wasn't diving too far across, got there comfortably with the left hand but it bounced out, pretty regulation chance really
forward press just outside off through gully who lets it slip under his legs, poor from Finch, and they get a run to third man
full ball on off stump, bit of a swipe across the line, good enough strike and finds the gap wide of mid-on
back in the crease and clears the front leg aiming over the leg side but a change of plan, just blocking a length ball on off stump
forward on off stump pushing up towards extra-cover
length on off stump, this time when Pietersen clears the front leg he unleashes a big on-drive and nails it into the crowd, lovely flowing stroke and got plenty of it
straighter line and worked out through midwicket
tries to force off the back foot through cover and gets a thick inside edge past the off stump, so narrowly past off stump, and past the keeper to fine leg, a perfect Chinese cut
touch fuller, angled towards cover point from just outside off
full delivery with a bit of shape into Pietersen, he defends in the crease having initially looked to drive it straight
pulls a length ball that's too full to pull, it comes off the thigh guard into the hands of Watson at slip, Wade's appealing again *rolls eyes*
a dab from the crease up towards mid-on and they sprint a very sharp single
a foot outside off on a decent length, Root angles it down to third man
full on middle and off, flicked into midwicket

good length ball and straight through Root onto middle stump. It shaped back a little and Root was playing with half a bat trying to run it down to third man, poor stroke to a ball which deserved more respect. He came forward and thought it was going to slide across him but a little bit of seam movement has done for him
full and wide of off stump, Morgan drives it to cover
straight just back of a length, blocked in the crease
a foot outside off trying to angle into the covers, too close for the stroke and gets a thick inside edge to midwicket
good delivery slides past the outside edge playing away from his body a little
forward on off stump, Pietersen gets a thick inside edge into his pad, nearly missed it all together
stride down the wicket and defends with bat and pad together
goes to sweep off the stumps, optimistic lbw cry from Voges as Pietersen misses and gets hit very high on the pad
comes down and drives this to long-on
length ball a foot wide of off stump, goes to pull but them pulls out of it and dabs it to midwicket
fuller and flicked wide of midwicket for a single
forward just outside off having taken a stride out of his ground, blocks towards cover
short and wide, poor ball cut to the square fence
tighter line, blocked from the crease up the wicket
forward just outside off to block into the covers
fuller length on off stump, driven off a thick inside edge that runs wide of deep square leg, they run hard and get two
tighter off stump line on a decent length, Morgan pats it up the wicket
floated up on off stump, Pietersen down the wicket and leaning out to block into the covers
touch flat and allows Pietersen to hang back and dab to cover for a single
down the wicket and clips down to long-on
a step down the wicket, gets leg side of a ball tossed up on off stump and drives it powerfully over extra-cover, very nice timing and lifts it over the fielder
goes to strike powerfully down the ground but gets an inside edge down to long-on
forward just outside off stump and blocks up the wicket
length ball on leg stump, blocked firmly towards midwicket
step down the wicket and tries to clear mid-off, Faulkner drags it down a little, Pietersen forces it towards mid-off and takes a quick single
blocked coming forward just outside off, pressed up to cover
forward again just outside off, blocking into the covers
length ball a foot outside off, Morgan dabs at it and plays and misses
forward blocking into the covers from off stump
slip is in, floated up on leg stump, clipped down to long-on
back and trying to pull a short-ish ball from outside off, finds midwicket without timing
swept from a foot outside off comfortably with the spin to deep square leg
tossed up on middle stump, Pietersen gets down and sweep hard for a flat six wide of deep midwicket, that flew
back and flicking hard down to long-on
reverse sweep, excellent shot, taken from off stump on a full length and nailed through point
good length on off stump, forward and dabbing into midwicket
full toss on off stump, driven out only as far as deep cover
down the track and finds a length ball to push out to deep cover
full just outside off and Pietersen drives it handsomely over mid-off for a one-bounce four, lovely strike through the line
slower ball, 73mph, Pietersen deceived and through a drive at it before the ball arrives, well bowled
length on leg stump, tucked to midwicket
floated up outside off, Morgan reverses the hands and swats a couple through point
drags his length down a touch, pulled flat through backward square
looped up on leg stump, Pietersen comes out and bunts it on the full to long-on for a single that brings up his fifty
full and swept hard, in regulation fashion through backward point, not cleanly taken on the boundary and they get two
deftly done by Morgan, getting down early and flicking a length legbreak over his shoulder, runs all the way to the fence
fired in a bit fuller, digs it out towards mid-off and they decide against a run
good length, outside off, walks out and dabs short into the covers

well, this is extraordinary, a sort of walking ramp scoop shot, using the pace and getting right under it to send the ball high towards fine leg, where there's no man stationed, it plops a few yards in from the rope and then bounces for four
touch short, drops back and pushes into the covers
comes forward and steers square on the off side
tight around off stump, dropped into the off side and they pick up one
continues over the wicket, angled across the left-hander, Morgan gets behind the line in defence
full and angled across Pietersen, who drives on the walk, fine of mid-off and they hustle a single
length ball outside the line of off, defended
slings in a full-bunger, drifting towards leg stump and Morgan jams his bat down, digs it out to midwicket
Johnson changes the angle and goes round the wicket, short-length delivery and Morgan pats it away behind square from in front of his nose
short-arm jab over the infield from KP, sitting back and chipping the ball out towards deep midwicket, game off the bottom of the bat, I think, and bounced well short of Faulkner
short again, pulled through the air towards deep square leg, again drops short - another single
stays back and nudges one into a gap at midwicket
good length, tailing in a little at Pietersen, who jabs down on it and squeezes one into the leg side
angled across on a length, opens the face and runs one to third man
goes back and across and drops the ball towards point
very full on off stump, punched into the covers but straight to the fielder
slightly overpitched on leg stump, whipped wristily through backward square, they come back for a second
length ball, on the stumps, blocked back down the track
full, around off stump, tapped back down the wicket, Johnson gets a hand on it in his follow through and mid-on cleans up
goes back round the wicket, pitched up outside off, check-driven towards mid-off
peppery bouncer from Mitch, sails through at around shoulder height as Morgan pulls out of his stroke
back over the wicket, length delivery, opens the face and steers to short third man
very full, drifting towards leg stump, hits Morgan on the boot - the appeal is wasted but the effort wasn't, another maiden from Johnson

on the attack and he's picked out cover! Watson's golden arm has hit the jackpot, Pietersen departing for a sprightly 60 but England probably needed double that... It was a length ball in the channel, KP drove on the up, didn't come out of the middle - swished slightly across the line, actually - and flew to Faulkner's right, he tumbled and pouched it safely, as Watson roared out his approval
short and over the stumps, Bopara gets out of the way
comes forward and shows a length ball a solid defensive stroke
this lifts nastily off just short of a length, Bopara drops the kitbag out of the way just in time
tight line, comes forward and shows it the face in defence
angled in, little bit of nibble off a length, blocked into the covers coming forward
round the wicket, on leg stump, nurdled into the leg side for one - first run for 13 deliveries
tossed up, advances and drives one down the ground to long-off, Bopara up and running
drags this down the leg side, Morgan takes the extra
length ball, straightening outside leg stump and fiddled past Wade, very fine and they pick up three

pushed back by Bopara, taken in his follow through by Voges and he's convinced this is caught and bowled... If so, it's a very soft dismissal. The umpires decide to check it, Bopara was just tapping down the ground, stopped in the shot and it came off the toe, Voges eased Morgan aside to take the catch and that will be out. England are five down!
floated up outside off, watches the ball through to the keeper
full and gripping just a touch, Buttler leans into a drive to cover
length ball, played back from the crease
skips forward, narrows the gap but Watson stays full of a length and Morgan can't get it away
rolls the fingers over a slower ball, sits up from back of a length and hoicked over backward square leg for a much-needed boundary
waits on a length ball outside off, drops it short and they scamper one as Bailey hurries in from cover and underarms past the stumps
works a single off the pads through square
drops back and glides a length ball down to third man from outside off
length ball, spinning back from outside off, worked with the turn to square leg
tossed up, Buttler pushes one into the covers from the crease
length ball, spinning in and worked to leg again
full and flighted, around off stump, Buttler leans out to defend
little bit shorter, rocks back and chops the ball into the covers, straight to a fielder
tossed up, opens the shoulders and squirts one through point
gets forward and punches a single to long-off
flat and angled across outside off, Morgan swipes and misses
down the leg side - another wide
sits back and skids a length ball to short third man, Buttler was quick to call it through and they get one
length, forced through midwicket and there's plenty of muscle behind that, it beats the sweeper running round from square to go for four
leans out, not much foot movement and hits uppishly down the ground to long-off
pushed back down the ground
Fawad drops a little short, Morgan crouches into a pull shot through square leg
gets forward and drives into the covers
floated up outside off, reverses the hands and swings hard, misses
opens the shoulders and goes hard at the ball again, slices away off the outer half of the bat and just past the diving Clint McKay at backward point
outside off, not much turn and tapped back
pushes this one through a bit quicker, has to drop the bat smartly to punch into the covers
on leg stump, nudged through backward square
forced off the back foot and it bursts through Voges hands, a tough chance but has to go down as a dropped catch
tossed up, leans out and knocks into the off side
flat and on off stump, defended
tight line, gets forward and pushes a single towards mid-off
Morgan tries to reverse sweep from outside leg stump, gets hit on the arm and pad, Voges and Wade appeal, a little optimistically
plays a delicate paddle-sweep towards fine leg for one
tossed up on leg stump, Morgan sweeps and the ball hits the toe of the bat and loops back towards Fawad, but short
turned off the pads
slog-sweep, gets under it but there's not quite the distance, it lands between two men at deep square leg, Morgan can breathe again
waits on a legbreak and turns one to leg
opens the stance and steers another single through square
length ball, straightening outside off, chopped to point from the crease
comes forward and strokes the ball into a gap on the off side

darted in, pitching on leg and skidding on as Morgan sweeps, Voges appeals for lbw and umpire Ravi gives it - but Morgan reviews and shakes his head in the same instant. He seemed absolutely certain and Hot Spot quickly picks up a faint bottom edge. Might have pitched outside leg too but we'll never know
hops back and cuts, can't get it through
very leg side, dross from Voges
on the legs, nurdles into a gap at midwicket, the fielder has to come in from the deep and they get two
works the ball off the pads again, Voges fields to his left
Buttler reverses the hands and tries to swat a length ball outside off that sits up, he misses and isn't far from demolishing his stumps in the follow through
dabs one to square on the leg side and they run hard for two
tossed up outside off, waits and steers wide of McKay at backward point for one
floated up on the stumps, closes the face to leg
comes forward and bumps the ball into the ground down to long-off
length ball, straightening on the stumps, tapped into the leg side - that's fifty for Morgan, certifiably back in form after a wee trough over the last year
length ball, out the back of the hand, Morgan gets forward outside off and takes one into the off side
waits on another slower ball and taps it square
line and length in the channel, leans on a push towards point
pitched up on off stump, Buttler gets his bat down in time to keep it out
another loopy slower ball, bounces up like a legbreak and Buttler tucks it square, the bat turning in the hands, into a gap for two
goes across and works another single into the leg side
length ball well outside off but Buttler can only dab it to point, McKay's loosener goes unpunished
driven firmly from just outside off stump, can't get it past mid-off though
short outside off, slapped wide of long-on but not wide enough as the fielder is able to save four

full outside off, tried to be swung over the leg side but it comes off a swirling outside edge that presents a chance to cover running back and Clarke clings on reaching over his shoulder. A total miscue from Morgan and England's task just got a little stiffer. He was aiming one of those whippy flicks over long-on but was through with the stroke a little soon and didn't escape the mistake
forward and blocked on the stumps up the wicket
slower ball, 67mph, on the stumps, spotted and dabbed through midwicket, they run hard and get two
off stump on a length, dabbed backward of point and they trot through for a single
full on off stump and pushed gently down to long-off
full on off stump, Stokes forward and opening the face to run it down to third man
back of the hand delivery outside off, Buttler slaps it down the ground cross-batted and picks up two as long-on runs to his left
full at the leg stump, clipped down to long-on just for a single this time
full just outside off stump, driven firmly and gets a thick outside edge down to third man
slower ball, 68mph, deceives Stokes aiming a flick to leg, he was through with the stroke way to soon and missed, well bowled
slow again, 66mph, dabbed from outside off to backward point, they take a single to the edge of the circle
length ball sliding into the pads, runs off the thigh guard towards midwicket and they take the single
full on the stumps, clipped down to long on
another slower ball, pulled from off stump to deep midwicket

yet again slow, 65mph, pulled from outside off, nowhere near enough bat on it, comes off a top edge and flies straight down the throat of deep backward square leg. McKay has bowled several excellent slow deliveries and this has bagged him another wicket. A total miscue from Stokes, miles away from the meat of the bat, it went a long way up but was a straightforward chance to Bailey
length ball at the body, tucked behind square leg for a single
back of the hand slower ball around off stump, Buttler steps to leg and slaps it on the bounce to mid-off

and another, this straight and flicked into midwicket, they sprint back for two but oh dear Tredwell is pretty slow and has been run out that was very laboured, perhaps he wasn't expecting the second run but what seemed an easy two with deep midwicket having to run around the ball to get a return in to the bowler's end has produced a run out by a comfortable distance, very poor running indeed
low full outside off, slapped from off stump through the covers, well put away
another slower ball, clipped to short long leg, they refuse the run
slower again, length outside off, slapped straight to extra cover
short ball outside off that Finn drops his hands on
a touch fuller but still getting up to chest height, Finn gets tucked up and wears it on the upper arm
step to leg and a pretty nasty-looking heave to leg that he doesn't connect with at all, it comes off high on the bat, ends up playing it one-handed, gets it wide of midwicket for a single though
back of a length a foot outside off, flies through and beats Buttler trying to force it away off the back foot, beaten for pace
full a foot outside off, slapped hard past extra-cover, good connection and drilled away for four
back of a length at the body, turned around the corner and gets two to the left-hand side of long leg

blocked forward on off stump, didn't know too much about where it went, spotted it going towards cover and set off for a single that Buttler wasn't even aware was remotely on the cards, Finn scrambles back into his ground
straight bumper and Finn ducks
full on the stumps, Finn tries to swing it away over the off side and doesn't time it towards mid-on
another short ball, Finn dabs it towards square leg, Faulker fields
back of the hand again, wide of off stump, Finn reaches out for it outside off and clumps it down to long-on

another back of the hand delivery but this one Buttler sees early and whacks it off the stumps over midwicket, a long way back that's gone, great strike and a first ODI fifty for Jos Buttler, an innings he desperately needed
length ball on the stumps, forward and blocked into the leg side, they sprint a single
steps across the stumps to try and play the paddle over long leg who's up in the circle, misses and thankfully for him the ball misses off stump too
full wide of off stump, Buttler leans across and just flicks it really but he's so powerful and he nails this wide of deep cover, quite a shot, managed to time it perfectly
now clears the front leg and tries to swing a full ball over the leg side, misses completely
short and pulled hard to deep square leg
back of a length on a straight line, Finn tries to swing it away over the leg side but misses completely
dabbed from the stumps to point, backing away
excellent slower ball that Buttler doesn't pick, swings to leg and misses completely
he's the power of Buttler again, taken from off stump, another slower ball and heaved over long-on, big strike
tries to go again but just cloths it on the bounce to long-on
slower ball on the stumps, Finn tries to swing it to leg, then pulls out of the shot and steers it to short long leg, then there's some confusion over a possible single, ends up a dot
forward and dabbing into midwicket for just a single, the man comes quickly off the rope
full and Finn aims a swing to the leg side and misses, Johnson followed his move towards square leg so ended up missing leg stump
yorker length on off stump, dug out to point
10mph slower outside off stump, Finn pokes at it and misses
yorker length again on off stump, dug out into the covers and they scramble a single
short and carefully pulled out to deep square leg

excellent yorker on off stump that Finn digs out up the wicket and that ends an excellent display from Mitchell Johnson, the England fans aren't ridiculing him anymore, superb today, pace, accuracy, aggression
full on the stumps, slapped down to long-off, Buttler's broken his bat
slower ball on the stumps, Finn watches it carefully, comes forward and dabs it towards square leg, they take a quick single
full delivery that Buttler tried to get leg side of and swing away, he got a thick inside edge into his boot that ran up towards the bowler
full ball on off stump and Buttler swings merrily through the line and clears long-on, another big thump from Jos
straighter line and a touch shorter, tried to be steered away leg side but misses
slower ball, turned from off stump towards square leg and Buttler will keep the strike with a single
step across the stumps and swings a flighted ball past mid-on, bit clunky but still got plenty of it

goes again but this is straight up, Johnson goes back from mid-on a few yards and takes a comfortable catch. He's thumped a few nicely today Buttler but that was a total miscue that went a long way up off a top edge, trying again to swing away a ball floated up on the stumps. Good solid catch from Johnson
Finn forward and gets beaten by a beauty that spins past the outside edge, turned nicely
touch wider, dabbed from just outside off to cover
tossed up on the stumps and Finn gets down to slog sweep and nails it into the crowd, great shot, great timing
now down the wicket, meet this on the full and hammers it over the bowler's head, Ahmed continues to be expensive
full on off stump, played forward and dabbed into midwicket for a quick single

full on the stumps, Finn tries to clear the leg side again but picks out deep midwicket and that'll do nicely for Australia. Finn didn't nail this like his strikes in the previous over and couldn't clear the deep fielder, Adam Voges, who completed a comfortable catch and handed a third wicket to Clint McKay
